ActionDispatch::Integration::Runner

Public Instance Methods

app() click to toggle source 
# File lib/action_dispatch/testing/integration.rb, line 318
def app
  @app ||= nil
end
default_url_options() click to toggle source 
# File lib/action_dispatch/testing/integration.rb, line 365
def default_url_options
  reset! unless integration_session
  integration_session.default_url_options
end
default_url_options=(options) click to toggle source 
# File lib/action_dispatch/testing/integration.rb, line 370
def default_url_options=(options)
  integration_session.url_options
  integration_session.default_url_options = options
end
method_missing(sym, *args, &block) click to toggle source

Delegate unhandled messages to the current session instance.

# File lib/action_dispatch/testing/integration.rb, line 380
def method_missing(sym, *args, &block)
  reset! unless integration_session
  if integration_session.respond_to?(sym)
    integration_session.__send__(sym, *args, &block).tap do
      copy_session_variables!
    end
  else
    super
  end
end
open_session(app = nil) click to toggle source

Open a new session instance. If a block is given, the new session is yielded to the block before being returned.

session = open_session do |sess|
  sess.extend(CustomAssertions)
end

By default, a single session is automatically created for you, but you can use this method to open multiple sessions that ought to be tested simultaneously.

# File lib/action_dispatch/testing/integration.rb, line 350
def open_session(app = nil)
  dup.tap do |session|
    yield session if block_given?
  end
end
reset!() click to toggle source

Reset the current session. This is useful for testing multiple sessions in a single test case.

# File lib/action_dispatch/testing/integration.rb, line 324
def reset!
  @integration_session = Integration::Session.new(app)
end
respond_to?(method, include_private = false) click to toggle source 
# File lib/action_dispatch/testing/integration.rb, line 375
def respond_to?(method, include_private = false)
  integration_session.respond_to?(method, include_private) || super
end
